summary: This is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding the preparation and filing of a motion to seal documents in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails discuss procedural steps for filing a sealed government response and a motion that intentionally omits Epstein's name to maintain confidentiality of negotiations.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email who prepared a motion to seal documents for the Epstein case, instructing colleagues on filing procedures.

events.title: Preparation of Motion to Seal
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney prepares and circulates a motion to seal documents related to the Epstein case, with instructions for filing that afternoon.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's office was preparing to file a sealed motion in the Epstein case on July 9, 2008.
The motion to seal intentionally omitted Jeffrey Epstein's name and contained general assertions regarding the confidentiality of negotiations.
Procedural instructions included preparing a sealed document tracking sheet and placing sealed documents in envelopes marked with the case number.
